name: NACM Cider Makers Ltd
goal: To promote the merits, qualities, heritage and authenticity of Cider and the UK Cider-making Industry.  To foster and promote consumer interest in cider and its responsible consumption.  To represent the interests of the Cider-making Industry and especially rural producers in relevant discussions with the government of the UK and the Commission of the European Union and to taxation regulatory and opinion forming bodies that have an interest in cider.
interests: Agriculture, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Customs, Economy, finance and the euro, Environment, Food Safety, Public Health, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives: Alcohol regulations with specific reference to Cider/Perry.  This include management of excise duty, customs and labelling regulations labelling and agricultural regulations relating to growing apples and pears for cider/perry making. Specifics include Review of Structures Directive 92/83.  Sixth revision cycle of the Harmonized System (2022), draft Implementing Regulation laying down rules for the application of Article 26(3) on voluntary origin labelling of Regulation (EU) NÂ° 1169/2011
